lines.line: They said I was too small, too weak to survive the flames that took everything from me.
The world seemed cold and empty as I sat alone, watching the rain fall.
My eyes watered with uncertainty about what tomorrow would bring.
But then I realized - I didn't escape that burning building just to give up now.
I stood tall, surveying the world of possibilities around me.
I found the strength to rise up on my own two feet.
I pushed myself, studying and learning to overcome every obstacle.
I reached out for what I wanted, refusing to be denied.
Now I run free, covering more ground than anyone thought possible.
Remember this: it's not about how you start, but how you finish the race.

parsed_script.full_script: They said I was too small, too weak to survive the flames that took everything from me. The world seemed cold and empty as I sat alone, watching the rain fall. My eyes watered with uncertainty about what tomorrow would bring. But then I realized - I didn't escape that burning building just to give up now. I stood tall, surveying the world of possibilities around me. I found the strength to rise up on my own two feet. I pushed myself, studying and learning to overcome every obstacle. I reached out for what I wanted, refusing to be denied. Now I run free, covering more ground than anyone thought possible. Remember this: it's not about how you start, but how you finish the race.
